summary: This document is a response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to an FBI inquiry, indicating that records can be obtained through the Interstate Identification Index (III) using the appropriate NCIC transaction. It appears to be part of a records request process related to an investigation.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: He is listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency responding to the FBI inquiry.

events.title: DCJS Response to FBI Inquiry
events.description: The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services provides a response to an FBI request for a search of the Interstate Identification Index (III), indicating records can be obtained through appropriate NCIC transaction.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The document is a response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to an FBI inquiry dated October 6, 2021.
It indicates that records can be obtained through the Interstate Identification Index (III) using the appropriate NCIC transaction.
Michael C. Green is identified as the Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services.
The document appears to be part of a records request process, possibly related to an ongoing investigation.
